So you want to get into the rabbit whole of Bitcoin? Well, I can provide some guidance.
Btw, you can call me NAT, as in Network Address Translation :)
First thing's first: you need a wallet. Think of it as an app on your phone.
Now, to set it up, you'll generate a seed phrase - that's 12 random words.
It's super important, kinda like the master password to your digital money.
Next step: your wallet uses this phrase to create two keys.
The public key is like your email address, where people send you Bitcoin.
The private key, though, is more like your email password. It lets you access and spend your Bitcoin.
Remember, keep your seed phrase and private key SAFE and SECRET.
If you lose them, there's no 'forgot my password' option.
You lose access to your Bitcoins, and no one can help you get them back.
The wallet I use and recommend is called "Electrum". You can download it at electrum.org.
